On way to @OppColl, grateful to celebrate future of environmental studies w/ @billmckibben, @VanJones68, @wcronon, @GernotWagner #visonaries
.@wcronon to @billmckibben @Middlebury #MiddES50: "Groups of first year students @Yale (circle of strangers) --> great political action."
.@GernotWagner @Middlebury: "Optimism is no longer a dirty word when it comes to Environmental Studies." He's the kind of economist I like!
.@GernotWagner @Middlebury: "#CleanPowerPlan is happening! China is moving forward! India has a tax on coal! So many things happening!"
From @billmckibben to @GernotWagner, @wcronon and Rachel Morello-Frosch @Middlebury: "Give us a hopeful story!" #MiddES50
.@wcronon @Middlebury: "It's critical to learn from circle of strangers. In liberal arts, create spaces 4 students 2 learn from each other."
. @wcronon @Middlebury's #MiddES50: "Ability of gifted speaker: come, listen to my vision" [He notes that this is hard to do on @twitter!]
.@GernotWagner at @Middlebury's #MiddES50: "Always step back & ask" 'How does all fit into broader picture? Adjust w/ every step along way"
At @Middlebury's #MiddES50, @GernotWagner: "Even if u go 2 Wall St., then 'What to DO with skills?' Make 'em work for what's in your heart."
At @Middlebury's #MiddES50, @billmckibben, @VanJones68 echo that skills, attitudes of @MiddCORE essential. On embracing failure, for example
.@VanJones68 answers @billmckibben (5) "When you leave here, it's not about deconstruction. It's about reconstructing a world that work."
.@VanJones68 answers @billmckibben (4) "To graduating students: you're not that awesome YET. In fact, you kind of suck [TO LAUGHTER]."
.@VanJones68 answers @billmckibben (3) "The thing that we need coming off these campuses. A little more humilty [APPLAUSE at @Middlebury]"
.@VanJones68 answers @billmckibben (2) "So then you need to diverge, to connect" (echoing @wcronon's great 'Only Connect'. of course!)
.@VanJones68 answers @billmckibben (1) "There's a rhythm to career. If u remain a generalist, u remain an intern: so you need to converge."
.@billmckibben asks @VanJones68: "What do you need people (including ES students) to be able to do?"
.@wcronon @Middlebury #MiddES50 (echoing @VanJones68's talk) "The humanities bring to the table : 'What does the world need?'"
#ESMidd50 @wcronon: "Disciplines are not a bad thing. But they prevent us from seeing" more broadly.
#ESMidd50 "Challenge for ES - how de we do transformational research? To make our data make a difference?"
.@wcronon "We need to take responsibility for commons & each other. How do we (coalitions) take care of each other & this place."  #MiddES50
@wcronon to @GernotWagner, @billmckibben: "ES can't be 'on the one hand' vs. the other." #MiddES50 http://t.co/xvPYExKwU3
#MiddES50 "Let's blow this thing up! Everyone should read @wcronon's books!" http://t.co/UedMAZzIYf
.@GernotWagner "I hope that in 50 years there is no environmental studies! It will just be 'studies'" #MiddES50 @Middlebury
We also welcome here at #MiddES50 @GernotWagner along with (non-tweeter) Rachel Morello-Frosch of University of California, Berkeley
Question for panel from @billmckibben: what have we learned from last 50 years of ES? #MiddES50
Also on our #MiddES50 stage: the great @wcronon!
